{"aid": "http://arxiv.org/abs/2504.02715v1", "title": "Equality of tropical rank and dimension for tropical linear series", "summary": "The tropical rank of a semimodule of rational functions on a metric graph
mirrors the concept of rank in linear algebra. Defined in terms of the maximal
number of tropically independent elements within the semimodule, this quantity
has remained elusive due to the challenges of computing it in practice. In this
note, we establish that the tropical rank is, in fact, precisely equal to the
topological dimension of the semimodule, one more than the dimension of the
associated linear system of divisors. Moreover, we show that the equality of
divisorial and tropical ranks in the definition of tropical linear series is
equivalent to the pure dimensionality of the corresponding linear system. We
conclude with complementary results and questions on combinatorial and
topological properties of the tropical rank.", "main_category": "math.AG", "categories": "math.AG,math.CO", "published": "2025-04-03T15:54:55Z"}
